canDo: I can give and understand simple directions to places.

grammar.point: Imperative sentences and prepositions of movement

rules.title: Imperatives for directions
rules.explanation: Use the base form of the verb to give commands and directions.
examples: Turn left at the corner.
Go straight ahead.
Take the second right.
rules.koreanTip: 길 안내에서 주어 없이 동사로 시작해요. 'You turn left'가 아니라 그냥 'Turn left'예요.

rules.title: Prepositions of movement
rules.explanation: Use 'along' (continue beside), 'past' (go beyond), 'through' (pass inside), 'across' (go to the other side).
examples: Walk along the street.
Go past the bank.
Walk through the park.
Go across the bridge.
rules.koreanTip: along=~을 따라, past=~을 지나서, through=~을 통과해서, across=~을 건너서

rules.title: Location expressions
rules.explanation: Use 'on the left/right', 'at the corner', 'next to', 'opposite', 'between'.
examples: The bank is on your left.
Turn at the corner.
It's next to the post office.
The cafe is opposite the station.
rules.koreanTip: 위치를 설명할 때: on the left(왼쪽에), on the right(오른쪽에), opposite(맞은편에), between A and B(A와 B 사이에)

exercises.question: ___ straight and turn left at the traffic light.
exercises.explanation: Use the imperative form (base verb) for giving directions.

exercises.question: The pharmacy is ___ the supermarket.
exercises.explanation: 'Opposite' means on the other side, facing something.

exercises.question: Walk ___ the park to reach the museum.
exercises.explanation: 'Through' means passing inside and coming out the other side.

exercises.question: Which is the correct direction?
exercises.explanation: The correct expression is 'Turn left' without 'to' or 'the'.

examples: Turn right at the intersection.
Wait at the intersection for the light to change.

words.meaning: the distance from one street to the next
examples: Walk two blocks north.
The store is three blocks from here.
words.koreanTip: 미국에서 거리를 말할 때 자주 쓰는 단위예요

examples: Use the tower as a landmark.
Look for the church - it's a good landmark.
words.koreanTip: 길 찾기에 도움이 되는 눈에 띄는 건물이나 장소

words.meaning: a marked place for pedestrians to cross the street
examples: Use the crosswalk to cross the street.
Wait at the crosswalk until the light turns green.
Take the second exit at the roundabout.
Go around the roundabout and turn left.

reading.title: Finding the Library
reading.passage: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the public library? Sure! It's not far from here. First, go straight along this street for about two blocks. You'll pass a coffee shop on your right. At the traffic light, turn left. Then walk along Oak Street until you see a big church. The library is right next to the church, on the opposite side of the park. You can't miss it - it's a large red brick building. It should take about ten minutes to walk there. Thank you so much! You're welcome. Have a nice day!

questions.question: What is next to the library?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'The library is right next to the church.'

questions.question: Where should you turn left?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'At the traffic light, turn left.'

questions.question: What does 'You can't miss it' mean?
questions.explanation: 'You can't miss it' means it's very easy to see and find.

listening.title: Getting to the Station
listening.script: Excuse me, how do I get to the train station? Okay, let me explain. Go straight down this road for about 200 meters. You'll see a supermarket on your left. Turn right just after the supermarket. Walk past the bank and the post office. Then you'll reach a big intersection. Cross the street and the station will be on your right. It's a big building with a clock tower. It takes about 15 minutes on foot. Got it, thank you! You're welcome, good luck!

exercises.question: When should you turn right?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'Turn right just after the supermarket.'

exercises.question: The station has a ___ tower.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'It's a big building with a clock tower.'

template.prompt: Write directions from your school to a nearby place using the template.
template.template: First, [DIRECTION1]. Then, [DIRECTION2]. You will see [LANDMARK] on your [SIDE]. [ACTION] and you will find [DESTINATION]. It takes about [TIME].

slots.name: DIRECTION2
slots.hint: Second direction (e.g., turn left at the corner)

template.correctExample: First, go straight along Main Street. Then, turn right at the traffic light. You will see a big park on your left. Walk past the park and you will find the museum. It takes about 10 minutes.

free.prompt: Write directions from your home to a place you often visit (school, work, store). Include at least 4 direction-giving expressions.

shadowing.sentence: Go straight for two blocks, then turn left at the traffic light. The bank is on your right, next to the coffee shop.
shadowing.pronunciation: /ɡoʊ streɪt fɔːr tuː blɑːks ðen tɜːrn left æt ðə ˈtræfɪk laɪt ðə bæŋk ɪz ɑːn jɔːr raɪt nekst tuː ðə ˈkɔːfi ʃɑːp/
shadowing.koreanTip: 'on your right'에서 'your'는 약하게 발음해요. '온 열 롸잇'처럼 들릴 수 있어요.

koreanErrors.errorExample: It's in the front of the bank.
koreanErrors.correctForm: It's in front of the bank.
koreanErrors.tip: 'in front of'는 한 덩어리 표현이에요. 'the'를 넣지 마세요.
